column1: Appendix Table 15. Estimated number of sentenced prisoners under state and federal jurisdiction per 100,000 U.S. residents, by sex, race, Hispanic origin, and age, December 31, 2010
Data source(s): National Prisoner Statistics Program
Author(s): Paul Guerino, Paige M. Harrison, and William J. Sabol
Appendix Table 15. Estimated number of sentenced prisoners under state and federal jurisdiction per 100,000 U.S. residents, by sex, race, Hispanic origin, and age, December 31, 2010

Note: Data source used to estimate race and Hispanic origin changed in 2010. Use caution when comparing to prior years. Counts based on prisoners with a sentence of more than 1 year. Rates are per 100,000 U.S. residents in each referenced population group on January 1, 2009. See Methodology for estimation method.
a/Includes American Indians, Alaska Natives, Asians, Native Hawaiians, other Pacific Islanders, and persons identifying two or more races.
b/Excludes persons of Hispanic or Latino origin.

Sources: BJS, National Prisoner Statistics Program, Federal Justice Statistics Program, National Corrections Reporting Program, Survey of Inmates in State and Local Correctional Facilities, National Inmate Survey, and unpublished U.S. Census Bureau January 1 population estimates.
